section.name: Building Functor
section.p: To build Commons Functor from scratch, you must first obtain the source, either from the SVN server or from a source snapshot.
Commons Functor can be built using Maven or Ant.

ol.li: Install a recent Maven release. Maven is available from http://maven.apache.org/.

With Maven installed, you should be able to run an arbitrary maven goal from the root Commons Functor directory. Use maven -g for a list of avaiable goals. Commonly used goals include clean, test, dist, site and clover.
Install a recent Ant release. Ant is available from http://ant.apache.org/.
Obtain JUnit 3.8.1 or later. JUnit is available from http://junit.org/. Note that JUnit is a needed to compile and run the unit tests, but is not needed at runtime by clients of Commons Functor.

Copy the build.properties.sample file found in the root Commons Functor directory to a file named build.properties. Modify this file to provide the location of the junit.jar file. (Note that Commons Functor supports a "shared" build.properties file placed either at ../build.properties or ../../jakarta-commons/build.properties, or both, relative to the root Commons Functor directory.)
You may run ant -projecthelp to obtain a list of the available Ant targets. Commonly used targets include clean, test, compile, dist, and javadoc.
